This option is selected by default when recording with the HTTP Proxy Server.
Has to be manually changed everywhere when you want to use SSL as connections 
does not seem to be reused (even with "Keep Alive" for subbordinate items like 
images, ...) and the maximum number of opened SSL connection is rapidly 
reached...

text:
The proxy server should accurately capture your browsers' settings. As far as I can remember, 
IE doesn't confirm to standards when it comes to HTTP 1.1 (in which keep-alive is the default) 
but you might be able to turn off the use of keep-alives in IEs settings. Failing that, you can tell 
IE to *not* use HTTP 1.1, which will disable the use of keep-alives if not specifically requested. 
 
The above should also work for Netscape variants. Keep-alive connections are fairly tricky 
things and implementations seem to vary depending on the particular browser.

This has now been fixed in CVS, in that the Proxy Server has an option to set 
it to false.

This should appear in the next version of JMeter (1.9.2?).

It's not only a problem for SSL - Keep-Alive does not really work properly 
with the default HTTPUrlConnection implementation...
